website_summaries.verdict: The exercise-friendly JayBird Freedom 2 earphones deliver powerful Bluetooth audio laced with extra bass response.
pros: Powerful audio performance with boosted bass response
External charging clip holds four hours of additional battery life
cons: Seriously boosted lows not for anyone seeking accurate mix

customer_reviews.title: Not good for sport at all
customer_reviews.text: 1. Cuts out when running (to solve this you need to loosen the cable to allow the remote to dangle, not nice when your running 2. Tips are uncomfortable, the fin and the bud are disproportionate in size, hard to achieve a good seal in the left ear. Too much movement left to right and they fall out. 3. Battery isn't lasting the said 4 hrs, after a full charge a 25 min run, battery went down to 60%
customer_reviews.author: Mr. S. Ahmed

customer_reviews.title: Bought for £50, not even worth that
customer_reviews.text: Had read bad reviews, but was less than half price so thought they should be good for the reduced price, but regret the decision compared to budget Bluetooth headphones I've bought. Headphones disconnect from the earbuds pretty easily (I guess a requirement of having the over/under ear fits but still make me feel like I'll lose them eventually), earbuds come out of my ears very easily, and are tricky to get in (for my large ears, but reading other reviews this seems common). Battery is not great. I've bought £20 bluetooth headphones with better battery, much easier and more secure fit, and better battery. Hate to give a bad review, but not pleased with this purchase
customer_reviews.author: C. Mckelvie

customer_reviews.title: Great sound quality with the App, won’t stay in my ears what ever I try
customer_reviews.text: Great sound quality, can’t get the buds to stay in. Even the smallest size (1) goes in my ears and “just” stays there when not moving. As soon as I move my head to one side they start falling out due to the pull on the cord at the back. Have tried over and under ears with no solution. A bit gutted as I really think they’re a great idea and look perfect for running and the gym. All of our ears are wildly different, so maybe some foam tips should be included too? Wouldn’t cost the manufacturer more than a few pence and may solve problems people are having with a £110 pair of headphones.
customer_reviews.author: Ian Spoon

customer_reviews.title: Good sound , great product quality, great batery , great functionality.
customer_reviews.text: It is solid product from Logitech. You can feel that it is well made. You can't compare this earphones to chip products. There is place for improvement in case of better sound quality or comfort. Fact that you need extra battery to be able charge them. Well I think few things they could do better... but overall ... for this price you can't complain. Sound is good enough, connectivity is pretty good, overall feel of the product very positive. If you decide to buy it ... I think you will be satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. A. T. Warszton

customer_reviews.title: Extremely poor value for money. Dreadful battery life. They don't stay in the ear well,
customer_reviews.text: Biggest issue is battery life. Mine are a month old and battery life is getting worse, Currently about 3.5 hours after a full charge. No-where near the quoted 8 hours. A gym session for me is 2 hours, so I have to re-charge every night or the battery fails towards end of day 2. They also don't stay in the ear well. I'm constantly trying to push them in tighter again to improve the sound, especially on the side with the heavy battery in the cord. These are an expensive product, and not nearly good enough for £80+
customer_reviews.author: Wayne V Randall

customer_reviews.title: Does not hold its charge well
customer_reviews.text: Its a very well designed earphone, just the weight weight and size. I used it whilst doing my runs and other cardio based training, however, there are some real design issue as I've had the same problem with two set. This was the second pair I owned, the first lasted about 9 months, whilst the second lasted around 6 month. The charge level will never exceed 40%, no matter how long I had it connected to the charger. And even at 40%, sometimes I would use it for 10 minutes and then it will turn off, fully. I tried updating the firmware. Returning my pair and going for something else.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Kunu Miah

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant
customer_reviews.text: Gift for husband for the gym. He loves them and likes they can connect to two gadgets- his iPad for movie on train to work and if he gets a call they switch to his phone. Genius!
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. G. Furse

customer_reviews.title: Average
customer_reviews.text: Its okay at a discounted price, however when i used the over the ear fit i did have issues with it disconnecting for a second every few mins. This is a common issue with Jaybird products. Overall very average and the positives are the Jaybird MySound app and how small and light the earphones are.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fabulous headphones
customer_reviews.text: My second pair of these, fantastic headphones, great sound and doesn’t fall out of ears whilst I work out
customer_reviews.author: aleryia

customer_reviews.title: Totally useless. Unless I held the phone (Iphone 6s) in ...
customer_reviews.text: Totally useless. Unless I held the phone (Iphone 6s) in my right hand then the bluetooth connectivity was unusable. Want to have your phone in your pocket? Forget about it! Head phones themselves are OK, but for the price nothing special. I also wrote to Jaybird to ask for assistance. 48 hours later still nothing. Googled the best fixes and the only option offered was factory re-set. Tried this too, still unusable.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Moore

customer_reviews.title: Best headphones under £50
customer_reviews.text: After losing my Freedom 1 headphones, I decided to purchase these as a replacement. Great sound,as the 1st editions are, and a better fit(despite other reviews to the contrary). Battery life still not great, but for sound and comfort alone....5 stars. The best part?? Under £50!!! Unrivalled at this price and nothing even comes close.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Doyle

customer_reviews.title: I personally didn't like the fit on these and sent back - not ...
customer_reviews.text: I personally didn't like the fit on these and sent back - not a -ve on the quality or design itself
customer_reviews.author: Christian J

customer_reviews.title: Great sound but horrible fit
customer_reviews.text: Great sound but I cannot fit any of the ear buds, the headphones stearing panel is too heavy and it pulls the bud out of my ears.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Ear buds
customer_reviews.text: Only problem is ear buds lost and can’t find anywhere to buy replacements so can’t use them and have tried everywhere
customer_reviews.author: smith

customer_reviews.title: Great earphones
customer_reviews.text: I love these ear phones. Great sound & easy control. Comfortable in ear fitment. Control slightly bulky on right side, unbalancing them slightly whilst working out, but lots of adjustability to counteract this in the main.
customer_reviews.author: Dr P.

customer_reviews.title: Meh.
customer_reviews.text: Uncomfortable after short use. Volume control too heavy for sports activity which results in the headphones falling out. Ok for office use or casual use. Pricey though.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan Jones

customer_reviews.title: Don’t go near these, they are wa*k
customer_reviews.text: Not only is the sound quality rubbish but they don’t stay in your ears and the charging system is terrible, brittle and breaks. Have had to replace the charging system twice. Bored of having such a rubbish product. Don’t buy, save your money.
customer_reviews.author: Hamza

customer_reviews.title: Great 'phones
customer_reviews.text: great 'phones. Having the option of over/under ear positioning, and different size buds, make them so versatile. Couples with easy connectivity, a competitive price and great quality - what's not to like.
customer_reviews.author: Richard G O'Neill

customer_reviews.title: Terrible connection
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for running and the connection was intermittent. I also tried pairing these with a few devices (iPad, iPhone, laptop) and all of them lost connection at some point. Really disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Defective
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately I had to send them back as they didn’t work. Left ear had no sound and right ear had crackling and intermittent sound. Would not buy used again.
customer_reviews.author: Lesley Anderson

customer_reviews.title: UNBELIVABLE
customer_reviews.text: Unbelievable headphones! Personally have never tried a pair that both sound and feel as great in the ear as the Freedom 2's. Tip design is also an improvement over the original Freedoms!
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Came without charging clip
customer_reviews.text: Came without the charging clip, so it is unusable. Don't even know if it works. Can't charge without the clip.
customer_reviews.author: Pseudo

customer_reviews.title: Good overall
customer_reviews.text: The ear buds are a bit uncomfortable for smaller ears even the smallest ear buds but other than that great
customer_reviews.author: kelcie holgate

customer_reviews.title: Nice headphones, but don't loose teh charging the charging clip
customer_reviews.text: Lost my charging clip so a bit annoying to have to pay 45 quid for a new one
customer_reviews.author: ACD

customer_reviews.title: Great earbuds
customer_reviews.text: Five star product. There are some jammings sometimes but overall these are great earbuds from all points of view.
customer_reviews.author: Ishidosan

customer_reviews.title: Bad
customer_reviews.text: I've had 2 of the same product and the left ear phone keeps braking, durability of the product is terrible.
customer_reviews.author: Robbie

customer_reviews.title: Great value and easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: My 12 yr old son loves these. He was able to set them up on his own without any issues. The variety of ear piece sizes meant he could find a size that fit him comfortably too.
customer_reviews.author: Megan jones

customer_reviews.title: good while they lasted
customer_reviews.text: Bought a refurbished pair which are now not charging after 4 months..
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money on these badly designed earbuds.
customer_reviews.text: Possibly the worst earbuds I've ever used. Don't waste your money on these badly designed earbuds. What are my issues: They do not sit in the ear for more than 5 mins without dislodging while working out. Constantly re-fixing them The volume rocker is too heavy and hence they keep falling out. Tried all configurations: over ear , under ear but they don't remain in. Even tried to tighten the strap on the back . After an hour your ear canals start to get sore. Bluetooth is not great. I have to keep my phone on the same side as the bluetooth reciever on the earphones.
customer_reviews.author: Conor C.

customer_reviews.title: Do your self a favour and AVOID these.
customer_reviews.text: Other than the fact that these would not stay in my ear no matter what position or eartip size I tried, they sound awful. Heavy bass and muffled mids and highs. Heard some £15 earphones with better sound than this.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Everything very good except some of the light bulbs got broken in transit.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best of Breed. Get Bose In Ear Tips .
customer_reviews.text: Best of Breed. Have had multiple generations of Jaybirds. Nothing better. Steer clear of Gen 1 but otherwise superb. To the people worried about fit - the rubber fins and ear tips are ok they provide. But....As a longtime user of these allow me to share a great hack passed on to me by another jaybird user selects time back. Pull off the rubber ear tips and fins they provide entirely (see pics below). Now go to a Bose store or order online the Small Medium or Large Bose QC 20/35 in ear tips (both work). These are amazingly comfortable. Seal sound. And work great. Strongly recommended. The replacement tips are purchasable online through Amazon also cheaply.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good sound.
customer_reviews.text: These earphones produce a surprisingly good sound. That is once you get them correctly positioned in your ears, which isn't easy, with the right size buds (they supply four sizes). I tested them with my IPOD. Connection was straight forward once I had worked out that you press the middle button on the headset to turn on and to connect. There is a book of instructions that looks substantial but only a few pages in English. The web site jaybirdsport.com does not cover the Freedom 2. The buds for Freedom are memory foam whereas the ones supplied with my Freedom 2 are basic buds. 5 star sound but 3 star in ear comfort so 4 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Andy O'Boogie

customer_reviews.title: Excellent, high end ear buds. Quality, but not perfect...
customer_reviews.text: These earphones ooze quality. The metal effect is very cool, they are small and sophisticated, and the sound quality is top notch. You have to fiddle around to get the fit right, but honestly, did you expect anything different? All in all, excellent sporty ear buds. The downside? Apparently, the cost of freedom is very high. These are very expensive, and for this price, you are competing with Bose and Beats. So...check out the competition. These are good, work well, stylish and practical. And if you can get them at the right price, I'd say go for it!! But YOU have to decide what that price is...
customer_reviews.author: M. W. Hatfield

customer_reviews.title: Excellent but better for commuting than sunning
customer_reviews.text: I use these earphones for commuting and I find them excellent. The good points: - lightweight - batteries last long enough for whole day - very good fit for my ears - they don't fall out easily and don't hurt - the cable is unobtrusive and help not to lose them - sound is the BIG thing here, I had Sennheiser Momentum before and these are Jaybird ones are equally impressive and cheaper - Bluetooth has very good range I am unsure if there are any really bad points for me. Were I running maybe, but for normal waling, commuting etc. they are perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Ajo

customer_reviews.title: Expensive considering sound quality and fit.
customer_reviews.text: Though I quite like the way the battery charge is split between two elements so half the battery can be charged while the phones are in use, which also has the added benefit of reducing the weight of the control unit while in use (especially important in reasonable vigorous exercise), I found the sound of these quite disappointing. And though there are three sets of cones provided, I just could not get these to stay in effectively enough to make light jogging comfortable: the buds just kept falling out! At the price I just don't think these are good enough. Barely 3 stars because barely OK:
customer_reviews.author: S. J. Williams

customer_reviews.title: Loud and Clear
customer_reviews.text: Very convenient to use and it great not being physically tied to a device. It connected to the Bluetooth on my phone without any issues; and the instructions, appear clear simple to follow. I've used them to listen to music, audio books and videos, and I've always been very pleased with the quality of the sound. The power lasts well plus you do have a power pack you can attach if needed; it is also light and compact, making no real weight or size difference to the earphones. I would recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Paolo Sammut

customer_reviews.title: These are excellent!
customer_reviews.text: These connect well in the ear and give a great sound. The tone is adjustable by way of an app so you can tailor these to be warm, boom-tizz or however you like your music conveyed. I especially like that they don't fall out when doing strenuous exercise and more so, the two earbuds are joined together with a wire that goes behind your neck. This is helpful for if you want to take one out to talk to someone, and of course if one drops out accidentally you won't lose it. Throw in an inline remote and I fail to see how these can be bettered. Battery life is great too!
customer_reviews.author: Adamski

customer_reviews.title: Seen some negative reviews about the fitting but in my case they fit better than any other headphones I've ever owned
customer_reviews.text: Bought them from their site. Seen some negative reviews about the fitting but in my case they fit better than any other headphones I've ever owned. Sound quality is insanely good. The adjustable cable finally solves the dangling problem and the pulling of the side where the controls are. As a figure skater I was looking for a pair of wireless headphones that don't fly away when I'm spinning in the air and other headphones are easily pulled away by the force. These Jaybirds don't! They stay perfectly in place! Only thing I'd love to be able to tweak is the loud beeping sound they make when you skip a song. Aside from that, I'm happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Marta AT

customer_reviews.title: An update to an already great version!
customer_reviews.text: These are truly smart and stylish headphones. Easy to sync with your devices. they come with a number of ear bud things to fit whatever size ear you have although i have one dodgy ear so they never quite stay in!. Perfect for running and exercising. These are an update of a previous version which i already have. To be honest apart from the fancy charging dock and packaging there isn't that much difference although they are similar in price.
customer_reviews.author: A. Douglas

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and good sound quality
customer_reviews.text: Ease of use: excellent - pairs easily, and comes with an app that enables you to fine-tune sound quality Sound quality - also excellent. Always surprising that tiny little buds can produce such rich sound Comfort - pretty good, but annoyingly they jiggled in my ears when jogging, creating a noise that competes with the music... which sort of defeats the purpose. Maybe I have weird ear canals, or there is a trick to fitting them that I am missing. Otherwise, really good
customer_reviews.author: MousieTung's mum

customer_reviews.title: Okay
customer_reviews.text: I do like the sound quality, and the product itself is very stylish (love the gold and white), but as other reviewers have found, they are somewhat difficult to get to stay in your ears. For the price (RRP £109.99 at the time of writing this), I would prefer to purchase a set of headphones.
customer_reviews.author: bexr

customer_reviews.title: Form over function pair of headphones with above average sound
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Good sound, light, comfortable, easy to pair, easy to adjust, well packaged. Cons: Slightly weak bluetooth signal in public spaces like stations, poor battery life: from 60% to 20% in 30mins, middling charge speed. All in all a form over function pair of headphones with above average sound. 4 stars
customer_reviews.author: Ed.F

customer_reviews.title: great quality for the price.
customer_reviews.text: These are a nice quality for the price. They are easy to connect to your phone, and the sound quality is pretty decent, not much is lost and it is not too bass-y, which most modern headphones are. They are ideal for when you are on the move, as they fit comfortable on your ear and do not fall out easily.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. & Mrs G. C. Stone

customer_reviews.title: OK
customer_reviews.text: The sound is OK with these headphones. They are a bit flimsy and tend to fall out easily. They join together round the back of the neck which I personally don't like. They are easy to recharge. For the price they are I could get something much better.
customer_reviews.author: TMUK

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic.
customer_reviews.text: A well packaged product and a well made pair of headphones - they are well designed. They fit easily into your ears without falling out which is handy. You get excellent sound quality. Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Lily

customer_reviews.title: Ear Buds Are Terrible
customer_reviews.text: Good sound quality but the ear buds keep falling out, as such they are next to useless. Very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Fraser

customer_reviews.title: Jaybird......just great!
customer_reviews.text: I think these are a superb pair of headphones. They are comfortable and light...the bass sound is good...I love the controls....so great.. The battery charger is superb...it's easy to use and has an extra four hour charge...so if you need to recharge it's easy to do on the go.... The headphones come with a storage bag which is great for putting in your bag.. I think these are superb...and they have a clip to clip onto your shirt so you don't lose them!
customer_reviews.author: mandynolan

product_meta.title: Jaybird Freedom 2 Wireless Sport Headphones With SpeedFit (Bluetooth, Range 30 f) - Carbon (Black)
product_meta.description:
Colour Name:CarbonFreedom revolutionised the world of wireless audio as the smallest sports headphones ever – freedom 2 with speed fit takes freedom’s sweat-proof, ultra-small buds and adds combined tips and fins, and integrated cord management for an incredibly secure comfort fit that’s ready in seconds for any ear size. Run wild in any conditions – rain, snow or mud – with freedom 2’s double hydrophobic Nano-coating; they’re sweat-proof and water-resistant. Run for hours, with 8 hours in your pocket. You can even charge while you run with the included charging clip. Use the Jaybird app to personalise your sound settings and never miss a call. 
Your FREEDOM 2 headphones come with a charging clip that attaches to the built-in control. Follow these steps to load them. Connect one end of the included USB charging cable to the charging clip. Connect the charge clip to the built-in control of your FREEDOM 2 earphones, making sure that the contact areas of the clip are aligned with those of the control. Connect the other end of the USB charging cable to a USB power source. Limit the charging time to 2.5 hours. To get the most out of your battery, we recommend that you charge your headphones when you hear the "Charge me" prompt, indicating that there is about 10% battery left. If you are pressed for time and you can only partially charge your headphones, you will enjoy one hour of playback per 20 minutes of loading. 


BOX CONTAINS
Bluetooth wireless sports earbuds; 3 sizes silicone ear tips; 3 sizes secure-fit ear fins; 3 sizes Comply foam ear tips (sport); Cord clip; Cord management clips; USB 2.0 charging cable; Carry pouch; Charge clip; 2-year manufacturer’s guarantee
feature_bullets: Secure Fit + SpeedFit You don’t have to think about your ultra-small buds staying in while you run, no matter how hard you run. You get soft and flexible combined tips and fins, and you can switch from over-ear to an under-ear fit in seconds for easy access to the mic when a call comes in.

Run Wild Take your buds with you wherever your run takes you– rain, snow, or mud. They’re double hydrophobic nano coated for the ultimate protection from sweat and whatever else comes your way – go ahead and run wild.

Custom Sound Pump up the bass – FREEDOM 2 works with the Jaybird app, allowing you to alter your sound signature to your preferred sound. Save your new sound profile to your buds, name it, and share it with the Jaybird community.

8 Hours In Your Pocket Just keep running with revolutionary on-the-go charging for truly infinite battery life. 4 hours on the buds + 4 hours on the included charging clip means you never have to stop – you can listen while you charge. Sensitivity: -38dB +-3dB (Test conditions: 1KHz, 0dB = 1V/Pa)
Always use the least thickness of plates
